profile.name: BEMELINGUE Wilfried
profile.title: Computer Engineering Student specialized in AI, Deep Learning, and Machine Learning
profile.summary: Currently seeking a 6-month end-of-studies internship in the fields of Artificial Intelligence, Deep Learning, or Machine Learning. Based in Île-de-France, France. Fully bilingual in French and fluent in English (TOEIC in progress).

experiences.title: Intern – Data Engineer (DataFactory Team)
experiences.description:
Intern in the DataFactory team at COMUTITRES (Île-de-France Mobilités), where I contributed to the overhaul of data processing pipelines.

Main tasks:
• Migrating scripts to Apache Airflow deployed on AWS
• Automating tasks via JSON files
• Optimizing Python scripts and SQL queries
• Designing performance indicators (KPIs) for BI
• Strengthening CI/CD pipelines with GitLab

This immersion in an agile data environment allowed me to deepen my skills in data engineering, cloud computing, and workflow orchestration.

experiences.title: Intern – Logistics Tracking App Development
experiences.description:
Contributed to improving and finalizing a web application for tracking air cargo (import/export).

Main tasks:
• Migrated database from InterSystems Caché to InterSystems IRIS
• Developed a front-end interface for displaying logistics statistics
• Created REST APIs in ObjectScript and Python, directly integrated with IRIS
• Administered and configured the InterSystems IRIS server
• Migrated internal tools to next-generation solutions
• Wrote technical documentation for internal teams and clients

experiences.title: Intern – API Interface Development
experiences.description: Participated in the creation of a web application displaying air freight flows, connected to a REST API. Dynamic data integration using JavaScript, interface readability improvement, functional testing, and contribution to technical documentation.

experiences.title: Intern
experiences.description: Arduino and mechatronics training, creation of a Smart Parking system and a remote-controlled car.

education.degree: Major in Smart Computing for Artificial Graphs (4th and 5th years, final year ongoing, CTI-accredited)
education.details: The SCIA‑G major trains engineers to design and apply AI on graph-structured data. The program includes advanced ML, GNNs, XAI, reinforcement learning, medical data processing, MLOps, stochastic modeling, and continuous optimization. Learning is driven by real-world cases and research challenges.
